CORWIN
v.
BRITISH AMERICAN TOBACCO PLC, et al. 56PA17-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. July 21, 2017 Alan W. Duncan, Attorney at Law, Stephen M. Russell, Jr., Attorney at Law, Jason M. Leviton, Attorney at Law, Joel A. Fleming, Attorney at Law, for Corwin, Robert (Dr.), et al. Michael L. Robinson, Attorney at Law, H. Brent Helms, Attorney at Law, Winston-Salem, Gary A. Bornstein, Attorney at Law, for British American Tobacco PLC. Ronald R. Davis, Attorney at Law, Winston-Salem, W. Andrew Copenhaver, Attorney at Law, James A. Dean, Attorney at Law, Winston-Salem, Robert C. Micheletto, Attorney at Law, Thomas E. Lynch, Attorney at Law, Andrew S. Kleinfeld, Attorney at Law, for Reynolds American, Inc., et al. James P. McLoughlin, Jr., Attorney at Law, Mark A. Nebrig, Attorney at Law, Jonathan M. Watkins, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Karen Seymour, Attorney at Law, Frank Schall, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Jobin, Luc, et al. Alan M. Ruley, Attorney at Law, William K. Davis, Attorney at Law, Winston-Salem, for North Carolina Association of Defense Attorneys.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 20th of July 2017 by North Carolina Association of Defense Attorneys for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 21st of July 2017."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
